thread.title: UK weather: Britain set to be hit by 70mph winds as forecasters warn Storm Doris may be on the way
thread.title_full: UK weather: Britain set to be hit by 70mph winds as forecasters warn Storm Doris may be on the way

author: Lydia Willgress
title: UK weather: Britain set to be hit by 70mph winds as forecasters warn Storm Doris may be on the way
text:
B ritain will be battered by 70mph winds at the end of this week, the Met Office has warned as forecasters said Storm Doris may be on the way. 
A yellow "be aware" weather warning covering the south of the country as well as Wales and north west England was issued by the forecaster on Tuesday amid fears the conditions may cause damage to trees and buildings. 
3101 Weather P ower supplies and travel may also be disrupted, the warning said, as winds reach up to 80mph in exposed coastal areas. 
Last night, forecasters at the Met Office said the system would be named if it was upgraded to an amber "be prepared" warning. 
A strong jet stream, with winds over 200 mph above 30,000 ft, will bring further rain and very strong winds this week, especially on Friday pic.twitter.com/TJKq3KroxI 
â€” Met Office (@metoffice) January 31, 2017 T hey said it was possible that would happen on Wednesday when more details are known about the system's progress, as it may instead move towards France. 
Speaking about the warning, the chief forecaster added: "A number of potentially vigorous low pressure systems are likely to move quickly towards northwest Europe later this week. 
A couple exercise their dogs along a foggy Weymouth seafront on Monday Credit: Stuart Fretwell/REX/Shutterstock "One of these, on Friday, may affect parts of southern parts of the UK. However, it is worth stressing that there are a number of scenarios in which the strongest winds miss the UK altogether."
T he Met Office also warned of potential surface flooding, but said properties near rivers should not be affected as it had been unexpectedly dry in recent weeks.
